data.meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).
data.sentence: The word كَبِيرًا comes from the root ك ب ر and is associated with the meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).

data.meanings: changing/altering -> with or without substitution, replacing/exchanging.
data.sentence: The word تَتَبَدَّلُوا comes from the root ب د ل and is associated with the meanings: changing/altering -> with or without substitution, replacing/exchanging.

data.meanings: to be good, pleasant, agreeable, lawful. tibna - of their (women's) own free will and being good (to you). tuuba - joy, happiness, an enviable state of bliss. tayyib - good/clean/wholesome/gentle/excellent/fair/lawful.
data.sentence: The word بِالطَّيِّبِ comes from the root ط ي ب and is associated with the meanings: to be good, pleasant, agreeable, lawful. tibna - of their (women's) own free will and being good (to you). tuuba - joy, happiness, an enviable state of bliss. tayyib - good/clean/wholesome/gentle/excellent/fair/lawful.

data.meanings: (Ha-Alif-Ba) To transgress, commit a sin, do what is unlawful.
data.sentence: The word حُوبًا comes from the root ح و ب and is associated with the meanings: (Ha-Alif-Ba) To transgress, commit a sin, do what is unlawful.
